instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.P5VS0_EN: What is P5VS0_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board with no visible corrosion. Green and orange light, no fan spin. Trying to turn on SMC bypass no fan spin. 

no  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>  and no  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>. 

5 volts on  <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> .

<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL> is not present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
What about <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> is 3.3v steady. Rest is not present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery)?
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> present?
Also check DC voltage at Y5110 (if no o-scope available).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Last value looks strange, but SMC works; as you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

"Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?"
???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Really strange to get <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>, but no <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.
Check diode mode to ground at L7560 first.
Post basic voltage for <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>; pins 23, 22, 12, 13, 29, 21.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> should then be present at L7560; check it again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I still get 0v both on <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_REG_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>P3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Check all <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> surrounded components, related to <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> section.
Pay atention to R/<CAPACITOR>C7564</CAPACITOR>.
May need to change <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: Yeah, just finished replacing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and fans spinning. lets see if it boots.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
